titles.title: Day Is Dying In The West

authors.author: Mary A. Lathbury William F. Sherwin

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of hosts
Heav'n and earth are full of Thee;
Heav'n and earth are praising Thee,
O Lord, Most High.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Day is dying in the west
Heav'n is touching earth with rest;
Wait and worship while the night
Sets her ev'ning lamps alight,
Thro' all the sky.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Lord of life, beneath the dome,
Of the universe Thy home;
Gather us who seek Thy face,
To the fold of Thy embrace
For Thou art nigh.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
While the deep'ning shadows fall
Heart of love enfolding all,
Thro' the glory and the grace
Of the stars that veil Thy face;
Our hearts ascend.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
When forever from our sight,
Pass the stars the day;
The night Lord of angels,
On our eyes let eternal morning rise,
And shadows end.
